image.altText: A man in a turban takes a selfie in front of an Alice Springs sign.

items.synopsis: Grassroots initiatives are proving "powerful" to help multicultural Australians decide how to vote in the Voice referendum. And now a date is set, individuals and independent groups are going to great lengths to ensure their communities are informed.

title.children: 'Hopeful domino effect': Grassroots efforts may be the decider for multicultural Australians' Voice vote

image.altText: Television presenter David Attenborough

items.synopsis: When David Attenborough was touring China in 1979, he asked a question about population control. Transcripts show it was one of the first mentions of the One Child Policy to Western media.

title.children: One of China's biggest decisions was a secret from the West. Then David Attenborough asked one question

items.synopsis: When Singapore police raided a suspected money laundering ring last month, they seized property and assets including a collection of about 60 colourful, mostly plastic figurines in the shape of a pot-bellied bear.

title.children: 'That's the sweet spot': Why these alleged money launderers might have been collecting Bearbricks

image.altText: A skier wearing a purple outfit makes their way across the snow.

items.synopsis: Victoria records one of its worst seasons for natural snowfalls, with record low depths observed in August, and a winter that goes down as the equal third mildest since records began in 1855.

title.children: Despite a strong start, winter was a bust on Victoria's ski fields

image.altText: Earth surrounded by junk

items.synopsis: Fragments of spent rockets and other debris are clogging up the area above the stratosphere. As tensions ratchet up on Earth, some space agencies fear the next frontier of conflict could be above us.

title.children: Earth's orbit is a trash heap. Here's how that could lead to an unstoppable junk cascade or even a war

image.altText: A man looks at the camera.

items.synopsis: While Yevgeny Prigozhin hogged the limelight, Wagner's founder Dmitry Utkin called shots in the shadows — in 2021, he broke the group's golden rule and lawyers saw their chance.

title.children: Wagner had a golden rule. When its founder broke it, lawyers pounced

image.altText: White banner saying "another sold" following house sale

items.synopsis: Skyrocketing house prices and mortgage rate increases have dragged housing affordability to its lowest level in three decades, according to new data from real estate analysts PropTrack.

title.children: Only 13pc of Australians can afford to buy a property, report finds

image.altText: Two very attractive black women with curly hair, both smiling and wearing black tops, one with a tartan coat

items.synopsis: Africultures is the place to be once a year on a Saturday in Sydney. The festival, which has been running for 15 years, attracts massive crowds.

title.children: Dressed for success: The festival that weaves together fashion, food and music

image.altText: A wooden board placed in a school garden reads, 'Our students grow, harvest and learn in this garden'

items.synopsis: Australian chef Stephanie Alexander says "making vegetables the hero of the dish" is the best way to make kids love healthy meals. And her new book, Fresh is has over 120 recipes to do just that.

title.children: Culinary star Stephanie Alexander on 'making vegetables the hero of the dish'

image.altText: A male batter goes for a sweep shot, with the wicketkeeper behind the stumps

items.synopsis: Mitch Marsh continues his dream run as Australia's Twenty20 captain, punishing South Africa's bowlers for the second time in as many games to rocket his side to a series-clinching eight-wicket win at Durban.

title.children: Marsh thumps South Africa's bowlers to seal series for Australia

image.altText: Presidential candidate Tharman Shanmugaratnam meets his supporters.

items.synopsis: Tharman Shanmugaratnam, a former member of Singapore's ruling party, scores a landslide victory to become the city-state's president, in an election seen as a barometer of public sentiment amid economic challenges and high-profile scandals.

title.children: Tharman Shanmugaratnam elected Singapore's next president after landslide victory

image.altText: A collection of credit cards.

items.synopsis: Ashlee Frost, 35, has been sentenced to more than three years behind bars after stealing from a pharmaceutical giant and posing as a travel agent and selling travel credits that didn't exist.

title.children: Woman who 'exploited' COVID pandemic to carry out elaborate scam jailed for three years

image.altText: Alyssa Bannan pumps both fists and yells in delight

items.synopsis: Melbourne overcome some early jitters to surge away from Collingwood in the second half, sending an ominous warning to the rest of the AFLW in the season opener.

title.children: Demons fly grand old flag and send AFLW message with powerful win over Pies

image.altText: Police at the scene of a fatal accident on the Hume Freeway near Chiltern in north-east Victoria

items.synopsis: A truck collision has claimed the lives of two NSW couples aged in their 70s, continuing a horror year for road crashes in Victoria's north.

title.children: Two roadtripping couples killed in Hume Freeway crash had just stopped for a coffee and a rest

image.altText: Michelle and Phil Dodunski sit shoulder-to-shoulder

items.synopsis: The parents of a young man who was killed while working on a gas drilling rig 10 years ago say waiting to get answers has been like torture.

title.children: Gareth died in a drilling rig tragedy. His parents had to wait a decade for answers.

image.altText: people holding fishing rods and fishing at a beach

items.synopsis: Data from the Bureau of Meteorology shows the mean temperature across the country this winter was 1.53 degrees Celsius above the long-term average.

title.children: Australia experiences its warmest winter since national records began in 1910

image.altText: tablets roll out of a jar

items.synopsis: Changes to the PBS that come into effect today could save people with chronic health conditions a lot of time and money. Here's why

title.children: New pharmacy rules come into effect today. Here's how they will impact shoppers

image.altText: Malcom Turnbull, Tanya Plibersek, Allegra Spender, and Lucy Turnbull take a selfie wearing "Yes" campaign shirts.

items.synopsis: As spring 2023 arrives and the referendum campaign begins, it's a far more treacherous landscape for Prime Minister Anthony Albanese than he imagined on election night, writes Annabel Crabb.

title.children: As Malcolm Turnbull took to the train station, the temperature of the Voice debate reached new levels

image.altText: A side-by-side comparison of the moon's surface with the second image showing a new crater

items.synopsis: New images of the surface of the Moon released by NASA show a 10-metre wide crater at the likely impact site of the Russian spacecraft.

title.children: Russia's failed spacecraft Luna-25 left a crater on the Moon, NASA says

image.altText: A plume of smoke is illuminated by a flash of light amid a drone attack in Russia.

items.synopsis: The attack, which damaged several transport planes at Pskov airport some 700 kilometres from Ukraine, marked the latest strike to rock Russian territory since Kyiv vowed to "return" the conflict to Russia.

title.children: Drone attack on Russian airbase came from inside Russia, Ukraine says

image.altText: Patty Mills drives into Luka Dončić

items.synopsis: The Boomers fell to a 11-point defeat as Slovenia dominated the first and fourth quarters of their FIBA World Cup grudge match to remain undefeated.

title.children: Boomers crash out of medal contention at the basketball World Cup

image.altText: A person with a hood on uses a mobile phone as the sit at an advanced computer set up.

items.synopsis: Digicel Pacific's network resources are likely being used by private spy firms to track unsuspecting people on the other side of the world and steal their call, message and location data, according to an expert cybersecurity analysis.

title.children: 'Blatant and malicious': Telstra-owned Digicel Pacific used by spies-for-hire, cyber security analysis shows

image.altText: Former Thai Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra wearing black suit and red tie.

items.synopsis: Thailand's king reduces former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra's eight-year prison sentence to one year, the royal gazette says, a day after the billionaire submitted a request for royal pardon.

title.children: Thai king reduces former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra's prison sentence to one year

image.altText: international students: Graduating

items.synopsis: A COVID-era visa that allowed more than 20,000 international students to work an unlimited amount of hours is being phased out, the federal government has said.

title.children: Immigration minister scraps pandemic visa for international students

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

items.synopsis: An Adelaide court heard the victim was 15 years old when police officer Jordan Lloyd Koch sexually assaulted her, after he engaged in grooming behaviour including sexualised comments.

title.children: Police officer jailed for sexually assaulting teenage girl

image.altText: A man and a pregnant woman stand outside, looking sombre.

items.synopsis: Daniel Buckley's wife will give birth in four weeks and they are still living in a shed after last year's floods. With an insurance premium seven times what it used to be, they will be "queuing up to have a say" as part of a federal inquiry into the sector.

title.children: 'In a headlock': Dad-to-be fuming after insurer's bid to raise premium to level of his mortgage payment

image.altText: The tails of Qantas planes showing the flying kangaroo pass each other at Sydney Airport.

items.synopsis: The government's decision to block Qatar Airways from adding more weekly flights prevented airfares from being made cheaper, says the boss of the competition watchdog, as Labor's president backs a review of the government's decision.

title.children: Allowing Qatar to add flights to compete with Qantas would have reduced airfares, says competition watchdog

image.altText: A young woman stands next to a red car in a car dealership.

items.synopsis: In a landmark case for the Australian automotive industry, the Federal Court has ruled Mercedes-Benz is free to set fixed prices and sell direct to customers, rather than let dealerships haggle, write Vishal Mehrotra and Rajat Roy.

title.children: The days of haggling at car dealerships may soon be over, thanks to this landmark legal decision

image.altText: Sam Walker celebrates

items.synopsis: The Sydney Roosters ended South Sydney's chances of playing in the NRL finals, and kept their hopes alive with a dramatic and tense 26-12 victory at the Sydney Olympic Stadium.

title.children: 'It's hard': Souths season over as Roosters win to keep NRL finals hopes alive

image.altText: A green bird with yellow and red and bright blue wings sitting on a branch.

items.synopsis: Native bird species went on a breeding frenzy during the Murray River flood and increased flows from upstream are feeding even more new life.

title.children: Bird breeding boom as Murray River flood plains explode with colour
